description: Two single storey rear extensions; two side dormer roof extensions; one front dormer roof extension; roof extension to rear roof slope incorporating Juliet balcony; roof extension to side outrigger roof slope; external alterations; and alterations to boundary treatment
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: ND/CR/00 (Location plan); ND/CR/09 (Proposed block plan); ND/CR/010 (Existing ground floor plan); ND/CR/011 (Existing first floor plan); ND/CR/012 (Existing loft plan); ND/CR/013 (Existing roof plan); ND/CR/014 (Existing street front elevations); ND/CR/015 (Existing rear and side elevations); ND/CR/016 (Proposed ground floor plan); ND/CR/017 (Proposed first floor plan); ND/CR/018 (Proposed loft floor plan); ND/CR/019 (Proposed roof plan); NC/CR/020 (Proposed street front elevations); ND/CR/021 (Proposed rear and side elevations); Planning, Design and Access Statement (dated January 2022)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy D4 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021). | The window of the roof extension hereby approved to the side outrigger roof slope that would face no. 82 Cleveland Road shall be obscure glazed and non-opening for a height of 1.7m as measured from finished floor level and retained as such in perpetuity.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).
